node.title: GENERATING INPUT FILE-Generating complex Geometry (trelis)
node.bodyText:
Hello all,
planning another project with moose, and I am having a meshed input file with a bunch of different elements. I previously used Trelis software to generate the simulation-meshed-geometry-exodusll-input-files, and made them by hand. However, this next project has too many elements to insert by hand.
Do you have any recommendations on how to effectively generate an exodus-input-file for moose, that can increase the speed for bigger projects?
I'm thinking of writing a higher-level-programming-script to interact with the Trelis GUI and automate the "create object" and "move to this location," processes. If there's any other way that any of you have discovered lease let me know.
Anything helps. Thank you!
Can you describe the geometry? Or the process you are trying to automate?

Yes.
I'm modeling a 3D core/(can) with a bunch of cylinder-holes in it, like in this picture. Its for heat pipes and heat sources that will be inserted.

The steps that I'm trying to automate are the following:
cut out cylinder-holes from the core/can at locationX from a CSV file I generated
reinsert cylinders(heat sources) where the holes were at
Add all cylinders(heat sources) to a common-block-object
Define side-sets for where the cylinders(heat sources) touch the core/can

Are you meshing the whole domain or are you meshing only the cylindrical holes (are they cylinders? or hexagons like in the picture?)
Step 3 and 4 of your process seem like they can be done in MOOSE using mesh generators. Let s think about it for the rest

I'm meshing the whole domain. It is a pentagon-shaped-3dCore with a smaller cylinders(not pentagons) inserted in it.
That's a relief that steps 3/4 are possible by using MOOSE generators, that's one of the biggest hurdle because step 3 alone would require 1000+ sidesets. Just for clarification, are you implying the following: importing an unmeshed-geometry with no blocks or side sets, and then defining those using the MeshGenerator linked below? I'll take a closer look at the MeshGenerator tomorrow morning.
You can add blocks and sidesets in MOOSE with parsed expressions. If you have 1000s of sidesets to add you will want to program a new mesh generator to do it

Mesh generation can also be done in MOOSE in some capacity, though mostly for simple geometries, and lattice-based geometries. See the mesh generator system https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/MeshGenerator.html
Guillaume

I'm thinking of writing a higher-level-programming-script to interact with the Trelis GUI and automate the "create object" and "move to this location," processes. If there's any other way that any of you have discovered lease let me know.

@japresa -- Trelis is now Coreform Cubit and it has a Python API.  This API was also available in Trelis.  We (Coreform) recorded a webinar earlier this year on using the Python API: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2TCPPO8z5VA

@japresa I think this is the preferred way. I did not remember that trelis was the old name for coreform cubit... We actually use the python API for cubit all the time.
I have examples online on the virtual test bed, though it s for 2D RZ meshes
https://github.com/idaholab/virtual_test_bed/tree/devel/msr/msfr/mesh
https://github.com/idaholab/virtual_test_bed/blob/devel/pbfhr/meshes/generate_core_with_reflectors.py

node.title: “make -j 4” is wrong,why?
node.bodyText: when i enter this command"make -j 4" ,there is a wrong pop up.

In the future, please do not create or comment on multiple issues pertaining to the same problem for an initial report.
Transferring to discussion as an issue is not appropriate.

I see that you are running this on a virtual machine. What kind of resources do you have allocated to it (number of processors, total memory, total disk storage)?
The issue here is likely that the compiler is failing because your VM is running out of resources.

node.title: Error opening ExodusII mesh file
node.bodyText:
Hello,
The mesh is made by trelis and can be opened by the peacockand. I have updated all,but there's an error I can't solve.
This is my input file :
[Mesh]
  [fmesh]
    type=FileMeshGenerator
    file =hollowcylinder_and_cylinder_merge.e
  []
[]

and the error :
Error opening ExodusII mesh file: /home/amos/projects/cat/hollowcylinder_and_cylinder_merge.e
Thanks very much，I hope your help.

Hello
I cant think of what would be the problem. Would you mind sharing that mesh file with us?
Otherwise, can you please double check the spelling of the file name in the input.
Guillaume

Hello Guillaume
I have checked my spelling of the file name,and maybe the problem is the mesh file.
This is my mesh file.
I'm looking forward your suggestion,Thanks.
hollowcylinder_and_cylinder_merge.zip

I'm getting the error below with your file.
Could this be that this is an exodus 8 file?
I m going to defer to @roystgnr who has a lot of expertise on exodus.
EXODUS: Error: Attempting to open the netcdf-4 file:
	'/home/guillaume/projects/moose/test/tests/meshgenerators/file_mesh_generator/hollowcylinder_and_cylinder_merge.e'
	with a netcdf library that does not support netcdf-4
Error opening ExodusII mesh file: /home/guillaume/projects/moose/test/tests/meshgenerators/file_mesh_generator/hollowcylinder_and_cylinder_merge.e
Stack frames: 15
0: libMesh::print_trace(std::ostream&)
1: libMesh::MacroFunctions::report_error(char const*, int, char const*, char const*)
2: libMesh::ExodusII_IO_Helper::open(char const*, bool)
3: libMesh::ExodusII_IO::read(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
4: FileMeshGenerator::generate()
5: MeshGenerator::generateInternal()
6: MooseApp::executeMeshGenerators()
7: Action::timedAct()
8: ActionWarehouse::executeActionsWithAction(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&)
9: ActionWarehouse::executeAllActions()
10: MooseApp::runInputFile()
11: MooseApp::run()
12: ../../..//moose_test-opt(+0x3153) [0x55d262d4a153]
13: __libc_start_main
14: ../../..//moose_test-opt(+0x33dd) [0x55d262d4a3dd]
[0] ../src/mesh/exodusII_io_helper.C, line 551, compiled Sep 14 2021 at 00:15:56
I made this mesh file by Trelis 16.5. And this is the output format.
can you try using the normal format?
oh,thanks,moose is working well now.
Sorry to have missed this.  libMesh can be built to support HDF5 ExodusII files too, but it takes explicit configure options to do so and Moose's build script doesn't yet add those by default.
hello,I want to use a file of HDF5 ,how can make the configuration?

node.title: Clang frontend command failed due to signal compilation error
node.bodyText:
Hello,
After installing MOOSE using the Conda environment, I am getting the following error while compiling in MacOS BigSur 11.3.1

Previously, I was not getting this error. It occurred once I upgraded my macOS.
Any suggestions are welcome.
Thanks,
Sourav

You may have better luck by following this thread: #17722
The gist of the possible solution, is to downgrade (or possibly reinstall... I had to reinstall) Xcode 12.4, run Xcode (to finalize the installation), and then attempt at rebuilding your Application /or MOOSE.
Thanks Jason, it works.

For those who experience a similar issue in the future, I am re-answering this question now that MOOSE supports Xcode 12.5, 13, and 13.1. Please update your conda packages to the newest versions by performing
conda update --all

within your MOOSE conda environment. See #19289 for more information.

node.title: Errors appear when using 'make -j4'
node.bodyText:
Hi Moose expert or user,
I am studying how to create a Moose application following this page (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/examples_and_tutorials/tutorial01_app_development/step01_moose_app.html). There are some errors appearing when I try 'make -j4' in the step of Compile the Application Executable.  Could anyone help me fix this issue? Thank you.
errors.txt

Hello
Are you using a mac?
If so look at the bottom of this page for the relevant fix (something about hostname)
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/help/troubleshooting.html
Guillaume

Hello
Are you using a mac?
If so look at the bottom of this page for the relevant fix (something about hostname)
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/help/troubleshooting.html
Guillaume

Hi @GiudGiud. Yes, it is a mac. It doesn't work and still shows the same errors after trying the hostname solution according to suggestions.
could you please paste the errors here

could you please paste the errors here

errors.txt

so it compiles with make but not with make -j 4?
Did you update anything?
This seems like xcode got updated, we dont support the latest version

so it compiles with make but not with make -j 4?
Did you update anything?
This seems like xcode got updated, we dont support the latest version

It shows the same errors when only using 'make'.
I updated the system to Macox Big Sur 2 days ago. I noticed there will appear some errors with the newest Xcode. So I downgrade its version to 12.4 according to instructions in another post.
I have no idea why those errors above occur.
so /usr/bin/xcodebuild -version returns 12.4?

/usr/bin/xcodebuild -version

It does not. I got the following error. But there is indeed an Xcode with 12.4 in my mac.

Ah ok let's get the version of xcode CLT to double check
Maybe try
xcode-select --version
and
pkgutil --pkg-info=com.apple.pkg.CLTools_Executables and look under version as Daniel suggested

Ah ok let's get the version of xcode CLT to double check
Maybe try
xcode-select --version
and
pkgutil --pkg-info=com.apple.pkg.CLTools_Executables and look under version as Daniel suggested

Thank you. The issue has been resolved according to your and Daniel's suggestion. I appreciate it.
Did you maybe install (or accidentally upgrade to) a version of XCode CMD line tools other than 12.4?

Actually that is most definitely what happend to you, as it just happened to me as well. My mac decided to force that update on me 👀  and I'm seeing the exact same errors. Type
pkgutil --pkg-info=com.apple.pkg.CLTools_Executables

I'm pretty sure you'll see the same thing under version:
package-id: com.apple.pkg.CLTools_Executables
version: 12.5.1.0.1.1623191612
volume: /
location: /
install-time: 1628330871
groups: com.apple.FindSystemFiles.pkg-group

Confirm your XCode CMD Line Tools path
(moose) fn606041:test schwd$ xcode-select -p
/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools

Delete the whole directory:
(moose) fn606041:test schwd$ sudo rm -rf /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools
Password:

Download version 12.4 (Command Line Tools for Xcode 12.4) from developer.apple.com and install it. Bam, fixed!

Confirm your XCode CMD Line Tools path
(moose) fn606041:test schwd$ xcode-select -p
/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools

Delete the whole directory:
(moose) fn606041:test schwd$ sudo rm -rf /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools
Password:

Download version 12.4 (Command Line Tools for Xcode 12.4) from developer.apple.com and install it. Bam, fixed!

Thank you for your suggestion. The issue has been resolved well. Appreciate.

For those who experience a similar issue in the future, I am re-answering this question now that MOOSE also supports Xcode 12.5, 13, and 13.1. Please update your conda packages to the newest versions by performing
conda update --all

within your MOOSE conda environment. See #19289 for more information.

node.title: Build Error - anaconda3 OSX + crash report
node.bodyText:
Hello devs and community,
I have a major build failure when going to run the tests for the MOOSE build in my conda moose env. This started the other while working with Github and doing a make clean then and attempting to make my MOOSE app which was previously working. I ran an update with Big Sur, then after updating conda, and recompiling moose, the failure occurs at:
cd ~/projects/moose/test
make -j 4 # <--- build error
./run_tests -j 4 

I then went to the conda troubleshooting and failed to run the script:
cd /tmp
cat << EOF > hello.C
# include ...

The failure also  prevented me from running make altogether for other cpp applications. I could not isolate the problem to Xcode, anaconda etc, so I did a factory reset and reinstalled Big Sur 11.3, dev tools etc and attempt to reinstall MOOSE.
I then received the same failure messages after repeating the above steps. As per the MOOSE error output, I have attached the error and crash report here below.
Thank you very much in advance for any guidance,
Paul
makeError.txt
mooseEnvBuildTest.txt
pcrecpp-7ca045.cpp.txt
pcrecpp-7ca045.sh.txt
This may be a new Xcode issue. I know a recent update occurred, but I have yet to test it. I'll do that now and report back.

I get the same error when running through the normal installation routine on latest BigSur (11.3). Prior to the update, things were working (aside from Peacock). The update included a bump to Xcode, and a large system update (11.2.3 --> 11.3).
Most likely, the fix will involve downgrading Xcode. I'll begin there, and report back.

Downgrading Xcode to 12.4 solved my issue. But not without some strangeness beforehand.
I already had Xcode 12.4 installed (according to Xcode, About). Seemingly there exists an update between this and 12.5?
I began troubleshooting by installing 12.5. Received the same error as before. I then downgraded to 11.4, same error. Installed 12.4, error went away.
During the mix of all this I had also tried installing Xcode CLT 11.4, 11.5, and 12.5. Which had no effect. Admittedly xcode-select -p continued to point to my installation of Xcode, so I doubt my system ever truly used my CLT installation(s).
The end result is that I removed Xcode CLT entirely:sudo rm -rf /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools, and installed Xcode 12.4.

@milljm how you install previous version of Xcode and Xcode CLT?
you remove the new one sudo rm -rf /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools (and the app) download the previous version from apple install it and then point at it with sudo xcode-select -s /Applications/XcodeVersion.app/ ?

Hello Jason,
Thanks for investigating and confirming this. Strangeness for me as well, as the failure was not linked to the Big Sur update, and I had an older (<=v12.4) version of Xcode that was working previously. Sorry I can't provide more explicit troubleshooting results since I reset the system.
Unfortunately it seems like that command to remove the command line tools will also mess up any other code/toolkit requiring to be built with Xcode, is that correct?
I will also try the above steps  Paolo and you  mentioned.

Believe it or not, that is Apple's suggested means of removing Xcode CLT (Command Line Tools):
https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/technotes/tn2339/_index.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/DTS40014588-CH1-HOW_CAN_I_UNINSTALL_THE_COMMAND_LINE_TOOLS_
which translates to:
sudo rm -rf /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools
Installing any version of Xcode is a simple double-click on the Xcode.xip compressed file (Xcode.app is extracted), drag Xcode.app to /Applications, which will replace your current Xcode. After that, you run /Applications/Xcode which allows it to finalize anything it may need to do, and you are done.
You may need to adjust your xcode-select path, if you were strictly using CLT only:
sudo xcode-select --switch /Applications/Xcode.app
Also, the reset feature might work best:
sudo xcode-select --reset
@marmolRBG Good to know, that you too had 12.4 to begin with. Very odd indeed, as that is the version I ended up with, which is what I began with... but now it works. Maybe Xcode needed to be... um, reinstalled?
take soooooooooooooooooooo long to downlad Xcode😆... I'll let you know if it works Thanks @milljm and @GiudGiud  to point me here.
It worked! Thanks again!
Can confirm I had the same issue (XCode 12.5 on OS X) and downgraded to 12.4 w/ success.

For those who experience a similar issue in the future, I am re-answering this question now that MOOSE also supports Xcode 12.5, 13, and 13.1. Please update your conda packages to the newest versions by performing
conda update --all

within your MOOSE conda environment. See #19289 for more information.

node.title: [FIXED] ⚠️ Avoid macOS Big Sur system update to XCode CMD line tools 12.5 ⚠️
node.bodyText: The current macOS update will bump your XCode CMD line tools version to 12.5, which is unsupported by MOOSE at this time. Avoid this, or you will have to manually downgrade to 12.4.
Is there an option when you upgrade to Big Sur not to upgrade the Xcode command line tools?

I am not aware that an upgrade to Big Sur upgrades XCode as well. Usually quite the opposite in my experience. I usually run into folks who upgraded their OS, but then fail to upgrade their XCode.
Edit: Oh I see the issue. Perhaps they 'fixed' that by lumping both together. Traditionally you're supposed to update both. But in this case, yes... we need to stay away from 12.5 for the time being.
If you wish to upgrade to Big Sur, you should be able to do that via the App Store (search for Big Sur, and install).
MOOSE now supports XCode 12.5, 13, and 13.1! See #19289 for more details and information about how to update.

node.title: CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I am trying to add a layer of a mesh block during the simulation using CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier. My question is what values of the variables will be assigned to the elements that are added to the Subdomain. If it is the initial condition, then the IC from which Subdomain will be chosen, old one or the new one?

You can choose whether to apply the initial condition.

If it is the initial condition, then the IC from which Subdomain will be chosen, old one or the new one?

If element subdomain is modified from A to B, then IC of subdomain B will be applied.

Ok that's not exactly how it's happening in my case. The variable (u) is not defined in subdomain A, it's only defined in B, and when I change from A to B, it just assigns u=0 in B, which is not the IC in B. Can I choose to have a different value than the IC?
Can you paste the relevant blocks from the input file here, e.g. ICs and Userobjects? Thanks.

[Mesh]
   [gen_mesh] 
        type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
        dim = 2
        nx = 100
        ny = 50
        xmin = 0
        ymin = 0
        xmax = 2.5E-3
        ymax = 1.2E-3
   [] 

    [solid_domain]
        input = gen_mesh
        type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
        bottom_left = '0 0 0'
        top_right = ' 2.5E-3 0.5E-3 0'
        block_id = 1
    []

    [powder_domain]
        input = solid_domain
        type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
        bottom_left = '0 0.5E-3 0'
        top_right = '2.5E-3 0.6E-3 0'
        block_id = 2
    []

    [gas_domain]
        input = powder_domain
        type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
        bottom_left = '0 0.6E-3 0'
        top_right = '2.5E-3 1.2E-3 0'
        block_id = 3
    []


    [sidesets_top]
        input = gas_domain
        type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
        normal = '0 1 0'
        block = 2
        new_boundary = 'top'
    []
[]

[Variables]
    [u]
        initial_condition = -1e5     
        family = LAGRANGE
        block = '1 2'
    []
[]


[UserObjects]
    [activated_elem_sd2] 
        type = CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier
        coupled_var = path_var_sd2
        criterion_type = ABOVE
        threshold = 0
        subdomain_id = 2
        moving_boundary_name = top_powder
        execute_on = 'INITIAL TIMESTEP_BEGIN '
        apply_initial_conditions = true    
    [] 

    [activated_elem_sd1]
        type = CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier
        coupled_var = path_var_sd1
        criterion_type = BELOW
        threshold = 0
        subdomain_id = 1
        moving_boundary_name = front_powder
        execute_on = 'INITIAL TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
        apply_initial_conditions = true
    []
[]

[AuxKernels]
    [path_elem_sd2]
        type = ParsedAux
        variable = path_var_sd2
        function = (y-0.7E-3)*(0.6E-3-y)*(t=0.01)
        use_xyzt = true
        execute_on ='TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
    []   

    [path_elem_sd1]
        type = ParsedAux
        variable = path_var_sd1
        function = '(max( abs(x-0.5*t+0.05E-3), abs(y-0.5E-3) ) - 0.1E-3)'
        use_xyzt = true
        execute_on ='INITIAL LINEAR TIMESTEP_BEGIN'
    [] 
[]

Edited: Added AuxKernels also.
@hugary1995 Hi, just wondering if you got the time to test this?
I can reproduce this issue. I opened a ticket here #18765

Hi, I also ran into this issue.
I found that in my case, I could get around it by setting the variable of interest to also exist in the inactive block (for you, this means set u to block = '1 2 3'). But just make sure that your kernels are only defined in blocks 1 and 2, so there is no activity in block 3 other than just holding the initial condition.
Please let me know if this works for you.

Hello
The warning is because the parameter is now called accept_on_max_fixed_point_iteration.
The error is some out of bounds error. Please compile SAM in debug mode and get a full backtrace for the error. I have access to SAM I can have a look. If it s not obvious we ll tag some SAM developers in here.
Guillaume
please avoid posting source code btw. Just email me at guillaume.giudicelli@inl.gov

node.title: Plasticity models - General questions
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE developers,
I am relatively new in MOOSE and to modelling in general. I am sorry if this is too simple.
I was looking to the inelastic documentation of TensorMechanics (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/ComputeMultipleInelasticStress.html) which was really helpful, but I have some questions.

Is there a difference between plastic and inelastic? Some objects are called PlasticBlabla.C and others InelasticBlabla.C
Looks like in the MOOSE script (.i file) there are different way to apply plasticity: Using UserObjects and Materials or just using Materials. Why is that? Also what TensorMechanicsHardeningConstant function? It looks like is use to define the constant parameters of the inelastic laws but why these values cannot be assigned directly?
When Multiple inelastic models are set, this means that different inelastic laws are applied to different blocks of the mesh?
Thanks and Im sorry if this is too simple!
Nuria

Inelastic can be creep deformation, plastic deformation, or both. So "inelastic" is a general term for non-elastic behavior.
Depends on the code design. Most of the constitutive equations use Materials. I believe crystal plasticity may use UserObjects too. User objects have a ton of applications and can serve many different purposes.
Multiple inelastic models take care of multiple inelastic models within the same block. For example, you could think of a simulation with creep and plasticity. One needs to use a proper return mapping algorithm and, in addition, make the creep solution and the plasticity solution converge.
Thanks!! This is really helpful!
